Circular

Piratini, October 5, 1838.

The authorities mentioned in Article 47 of the Regulation of the State Collectories, mandated for execution by Decree of August 14 last, the Government determines that from now on all hides exported without a guide from the owners of the brands, in which they declare their sale to the exporter, or from the Commanders of Army forces and Chiefs of Police of the Republic, with the signature of those Commanders of the Brigades or Divisions, in case they come from consumption, shall be seized, confiscated, and sold at public auction to the highest bidder at the Collectory of the District where said seizure takes place.

The proceeds from the seized and thus disposed hides shall be divided into two equal parts, one for the seizure officer or officers, which shall be immediately delivered, and the other for the National Treasury, as provided in Article 42 of the cited regulation: which shall be complied with.
